description:
Erection of basement and 6-storey building (gross floorspace 6394 square metres) containing Class A1 basement and ground floor retail units on Great Sutton Street, a Class A3 basement and ground floor restaurant on Goswell Road and a 128 bedroom Class C1 hotel in the remainder of the building; use of upper floors of 'Hat and Feathers' public house as additional hotel accommodation and linking of them to the new hotel. 

 APPLICANTS' PLAN NOS.:  HF/A0/Site/(A); HF/A2/BS, GR, 04,                         05, HF/A2/01(A), 02(A), 03(A),                         RF(A); HF/A4/BS & GR; HF/A4/01 AND                         02(B); HF/A4/03 AND RF(B); HF/A5/                         Clrk(A); HF/A5/GOS; HF/A5/GSSt(A);                         HF/A5/IntEl, HF/A5/persp(B), AA,                         BB, CC.
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed development by reason of its inappropriate scale and excessive bulk would be incongruous and out of scale with and have a detrimental impact on the setting of the statutorily listed 'Hat and Feathers' building, contrary to Policy D38 of the Islington Unitary Development Plan.
